_metadata.description: Comprehensive 17-attribute field documentation for MachShop MES

workOrderNumber.description: Human-readable unique identifier for manufacturing work orders
workOrderNumber.businessRule: Sequential numbering per site per year, must be globally unique, cannot be modified once created
workOrderNumber.dataSource: Auto-generated by production planning system upon work order creation
workOrderNumber.format: WO-YYYY-NNNNNN where YYYY=4-digit year, NNNNNN=6-digit sequential number
workOrderNumber.validation: Regex: ^WO-\d{4}-[R]?\d{6}$ AND must be unique across all WorkOrder records
workOrderNumber.privacy: Business Sensitive - contains production planning information
workOrderNumber.retention: Permanent retention required for production history and audit trails
workOrderNumber.auditTrail: All references and usage tracked for traceability, immutable once created
workOrderNumber.businessImpact: Primary reference for production tracking, customer communication, and financial reporting
workOrderNumber.complianceNotes: AS9100: Required for aerospace traceability. ISO9001: Part of quality record retention
workOrderNumber.businessPurpose: Provides unique identification for work orders across all business functions
workOrderNumber.businessJustification: Enables complete traceability from customer order through production to delivery
workOrderNumber.consequences: Duplicate or invalid numbers break production tracking and customer visibility

priority.description: Production priority level affecting scheduling and resource allocation
priority.businessRule: Set by production planning based on customer requirements and delivery commitments
priority.dataSource: Production planning team via MES interface or ERP integration
priority.validation: Must be valid WorkOrderPriority enum value
priority.calculations: May be auto-calculated based on customerPriority + deliveryDate proximity
priority.privacy: Business Confidential - affects resource allocation decisions
priority.retention: Retain for 7 years per manufacturing records policy
priority.auditTrail: Track all priority changes with timestamp and responsible user
priority.businessImpact: Drives scheduling algorithms, resource allocation, and overtime decisions
priority.complianceNotes: Customer contracts may specify minimum priority levels for certain product lines
priority.businessPurpose: Ensures critical customer orders receive appropriate production priority
priority.businessJustification: Balances customer satisfaction with efficient resource utilization
priority.consequences: Incorrect priority causes missed delivery dates or inefficient resource usage

actualStartDate.description: Timestamp when production actually began on this work order
actualStartDate.businessRule: Set when first operation starts, cannot be changed once set, required for production metrics
actualStartDate.dataSource: Automatically captured from shop floor data collection systems
actualStartDate.validation: Must be >= scheduledStartDate, cannot be in future, immutable once set
actualStartDate.retention: Permanent retention for production metrics and continuous improvement
actualStartDate.auditTrail: Critical for AS9100 traceability, all access logged for audit purposes
actualStartDate.businessImpact: Foundation for all production timing metrics, on-time delivery tracking, and efficiency analysis
actualStartDate.complianceNotes: AS9100: Required for production record traceability. FDA: Critical for medical device production history
actualStartDate.businessPurpose: Provides accurate production start time for metrics and customer communication
actualStartDate.businessJustification: Enables measurement of production efficiency and delivery performance
actualStartDate.consequences: Missing or incorrect start times invalidate production metrics and customer delivery estimates

lotNumber.description: Unique identification number for material lot traceability
lotNumber.businessRule: Must be globally unique across all materials, required for regulated products, cannot be changed
lotNumber.dataSource: Supplier-provided or internally generated based on material type and receipt date
lotNumber.format: Alphanumeric, typically 8-20 characters, format varies by supplier/material type
lotNumber.validation: Required field, must be unique globally, alphanumeric characters only
lotNumber.calculations: Internal lots: MAT-YYYYMMDD-NNN where NNN is sequential daily counter
lotNumber.privacy: Business Sensitive - contains supplier and production information
lotNumber.retention: Permanent retention required for FDA/AS9100 traceability
lotNumber.auditTrail: All material movements and usage tracked by lot number for complete traceability
lotNumber.businessImpact: Enables complete material traceability for quality issues and regulatory compliance
lotNumber.complianceNotes: FDA: Required for medical device material traceability. AS9100: Critical for aerospace material certification
lotNumber.businessPurpose: Provides unique identification for material batches throughout supply chain
lotNumber.businessJustification: Enables rapid identification and isolation of defective materials
lotNumber.consequences: Missing or duplicate lot numbers break regulatory traceability and recall capability

unitOfMeasure.description: Standard unit of measurement for material quantity tracking
unitOfMeasure.businessRule: Must use standard engineering units, consistent with supplier and customer specifications
unitOfMeasure.dataSource: Engineering specifications or supplier material specifications
unitOfMeasure.format: Standard engineering unit abbreviations (kg, lb, ft, m, L, gal, ea, pc)
unitOfMeasure.validation: Must be from approved units list, required for all materials
unitOfMeasure.calculations: Used in inventory valuations: totalValue = quantity * unitPrice
unitOfMeasure.retention: Permanent retention with material specifications
unitOfMeasure.auditTrail: Changes require engineering approval and version control
unitOfMeasure.businessImpact: Foundation for all quantity calculations, inventory management, and cost accounting
unitOfMeasure.complianceNotes: Must comply with customer requirements and international standards (SI units preferred)
unitOfMeasure.businessPurpose: Standardizes quantity measurements across all business systems
unitOfMeasure.businessJustification: Prevents measurement errors and enables accurate inventory and cost management
unitOfMeasure.consequences: Incorrect units cause inventory errors, costing mistakes, and customer delivery issues

result.description: Measured value from quality inspection or test
result.businessRule: Must be within specification limits or trigger non-conformance process
result.dataSource: Quality inspection equipment or manual measurement by certified inspectors
result.format: Numeric value with appropriate precision based on measurement capability
result.validation: Must be numeric for dimensional measurements, or PASS/FAIL for go/no-go tests
result.calculations: Compared against LSL and USL: nonConforming = (result < LSL OR result > USL)
result.privacy: Quality Sensitive - may indicate product performance characteristics
result.retention: Permanent retention for quality records and statistical analysis
result.auditTrail: All measurements tracked with inspector ID, timestamp, and equipment used
result.businessImpact: Determines product conformance and drives quality decisions
result.validValues: Numeric values within measurement range, or PASS/FAIL for attribute tests
result.complianceNotes: AS9100: Required for aerospace quality records. FDA: Critical for medical device validation
result.businessPurpose: Documents actual measured values for quality control and process improvement
result.businessJustification: Ensures only conforming products are delivered to customers
result.consequences: Incorrect measurements risk shipping non-conforming products and customer issues

employeeNumber.description: Unique employee identifier linking to HR system records
employeeNumber.businessRule: Must match active employee records in HR system, required for system access
employeeNumber.validation: Must exist in HR.ActiveEmployees table, required for non-guest users
employeeNumber.calculations: Used in payroll calculations and labor cost allocations
employeeNumber.privacy: Personally Identifiable Information (PII) - restricted access required
employeeNumber.retention: Retain for 7 years after employment termination per HR policy
employeeNumber.auditTrail: All system access and actions tracked by employee number for security audit
employeeNumber.businessImpact: Links all system activities to specific employees for accountability and security
employeeNumber.validValues: Valid employee numbers from HR system active employee list
employeeNumber.complianceNotes: SOX: Required for access control audit trails. GDPR: Personal data requiring protection
employeeNumber.businessPurpose: Provides unique identification for employee system access and activity tracking
employeeNumber.businessJustification: Ensures accountability and enables proper labor cost allocation
employeeNumber.consequences: Invalid employee numbers prevent system access and break audit trails

calibrationDate.description: Date when equipment was last calibrated for measurement accuracy
calibrationDate.businessRule: Must be updated after each calibration event, required for measurement equipment
calibrationDate.dataSource: Calibration management system or manual entry by qualified technicians
calibrationDate.validation: Must be <= current date, required for equipment with calibrationRequired = true
calibrationDate.retention: Permanent retention required for calibration history and audit trails
calibrationDate.auditTrail: All calibration events logged for AS9100 and FDA compliance
calibrationDate.businessImpact: Determines equipment usability for quality-critical measurements
calibrationDate.complianceNotes: AS9100: Required for measurement equipment calibration records. FDA: Critical for equipment validation
calibrationDate.businessPurpose: Ensures measurement equipment produces accurate and traceable results
calibrationDate.businessJustification: Maintains measurement system integrity and supports product quality assurance
calibrationDate.consequences: Expired calibration invalidates measurements and risks non-conforming product release

operatingHours.description: Cumulative hours of equipment operation for maintenance scheduling
operatingHours.businessRule: Automatically incremented during equipment operation, used for preventive maintenance triggers
operatingHours.dataSource: Equipment controllers or manual operator entry
operatingHours.format: Positive decimal number representing total operational hours
operatingHours.validation: Must be >= 0, cannot decrease, increments only when equipment status = 'RUNNING'
operatingHours.retention: 7 years for maintenance planning and asset management
operatingHours.auditTrail: Operating hour changes tracked for maintenance scheduling accuracy
operatingHours.businessImpact: Drives preventive maintenance scheduling and equipment replacement planning
operatingHours.complianceNotes: AS9100: Required for equipment maintenance records and reliability analysis
operatingHours.businessPurpose: Tracks equipment usage to optimize maintenance intervals and prevent failures
operatingHours.businessJustification: Enables predictive maintenance and maximizes equipment availability
operatingHours.consequences: Inaccurate operating hours cause maintenance schedule errors and potential equipment failures

approvalStatus.description: Current approval state of the quality plan
approvalStatus.businessRule: Requires approvals from both Engineering and Quality departments before production use
approvalStatus.validation: Must be valid QualityPlanStatus enum value
approvalStatus.calculations: Auto-transitions to APPROVED when all required approvals received
approvalStatus.retention: Permanent retention for quality system records
approvalStatus.auditTrail: All status changes logged with approver identity and timestamp
approvalStatus.businessImpact: Controls when quality plans can be used in production
approvalStatus.complianceNotes: AS9100: Required for quality plan approval workflow. FDA: Critical for process validation
approvalStatus.businessPurpose: Ensures quality plans meet all technical and regulatory requirements before use
approvalStatus.businessJustification: Prevents use of unvalidated quality procedures that could compromise product conformance
approvalStatus.consequences: Unapproved quality plans risk non-conforming products and regulatory violations

version.description: Version control number for quality plan revisions
version.businessRule: Auto-incremented on each modification, creates immutable revision history
version.validation: Must be unique for each quality plan, increases monotonically
version.calculations: New version = MAX(existing versions) + increment based on change type
version.retention: Permanent retention for all versions and change history
version.auditTrail: Version changes tracked with modification details and responsible user
version.businessImpact: Enables quality plan change control and historical traceability
version.complianceNotes: AS9100: Required for document control and change management. FDA: Critical for process change control
version.businessPurpose: Maintains complete revision history for quality plan changes
version.businessJustification: Enables rollback to previous versions and tracks process evolution
version.consequences: Poor version control causes confusion about current procedures and audit trail gaps

receivedDate.description: Date when material lot was received into inventory
receivedDate.businessRule: Set automatically upon goods receipt, cannot be modified once set
receivedDate.dataSource: Warehouse management system or receiving transaction
receivedDate.validation: Must be <= current date, required field, immutable once set
receivedDate.retention: 7 years for inventory and financial audit purposes
receivedDate.auditTrail: Receipt events tracked for material traceability and cost accounting
receivedDate.businessImpact: Foundation for inventory aging analysis and FIFO costing
receivedDate.complianceNotes: GAAP: Required for inventory valuation. AS9100: Critical for material traceability
receivedDate.businessPurpose: Records when materials became available for production use
receivedDate.businessJustification: Enables accurate inventory aging and shelf life management
receivedDate.consequences: Incorrect receipt dates cause inventory valuation errors and expired material usage

certificationStatus.description: Supplier certification approval status for material quality
certificationStatus.businessRule: Must be APPROVED before material can be used in production
certificationStatus.dataSource: Quality management system or supplier portal
certificationStatus.validation: Must be valid CertificationStatus enum value
certificationStatus.calculations: Auto-expires based on supplier certification validity period
certificationStatus.retention: Permanent retention for supplier qualification records
certificationStatus.auditTrail: Certification decisions logged with reviewer identity and supporting documentation
certificationStatus.businessImpact: Controls material availability for production and affects supplier performance
certificationStatus.complianceNotes: AS9100: Required for supplier control. FDA: Critical for material qualification in regulated products
certificationStatus.businessPurpose: Ensures only qualified materials from approved suppliers are used in production
certificationStatus.businessJustification: Prevents quality issues from uncertified or non-conforming materials
certificationStatus.consequences: Using uncertified materials risks product quality and regulatory non-compliance

setupTime.privacy: Business Sensitive - contains proprietary manufacturing time standards
setupTime.retention: Permanent retention for engineering standards and cost accounting
setupTime.auditTrail: Setup time changes require engineering approval and version control
setupTime.businessImpact: Drives production scheduling, capacity planning, and product costing
setupTime.complianceNotes: ISO9001: Part of process documentation and control
setupTime.businessPurpose: Provides accurate time estimates for production planning and cost calculation
setupTime.businessJustification: Enables realistic scheduling and competitive product pricing
setupTime.consequences: Inaccurate setup times cause scheduling conflicts and cost estimation errors

laborGrade.businessRule: Must match available labor pool skill levels, affects labor cost calculation

severity.description: Impact level of the non-conformance on product quality and customer satisfaction
severity.businessRule: Must be assessed within 2 hours of identification, drives response urgency
severity.dataSource: Quality inspector assessment or automated detection system
severity.validation: Must be valid NonConformanceSeverity enum value, required field
severity.calculations: Response time requirements calculated based on severity level
severity.privacy: Quality Sensitive - may indicate product performance issues
severity.retention: Permanent retention for quality trending and customer reporting
severity.auditTrail: Severity assessments logged with justification and responsible quality personnel
severity.businessImpact: Determines containment urgency and customer notification requirements
severity.complianceNotes: AS9100: Required for non-conformance management. FDA: Critical for adverse event reporting
severity.businessPurpose: Prioritizes non-conformance response based on potential impact
severity.businessJustification: Ensures appropriate resource allocation and timely resolution of quality issues
severity.consequences: Incorrect severity assessment delays critical responses and risks customer impact

rootCauseAnalysis.description: Detailed investigation findings identifying the fundamental cause of non-conformance
rootCauseAnalysis.businessRule: Required before closure, must identify systemic causes not just symptoms
rootCauseAnalysis.dataSource: Quality engineer investigation using 5-Why, fishbone, or similar methodologies
rootCauseAnalysis.format: Structured text document with methodology, findings, and evidence
examples: Fishbone analysis identifies worn tooling as root cause
rootCauseAnalysis.validation: Required field for closure, must be non-empty and approved by quality manager
rootCauseAnalysis.privacy: Business Confidential - may reveal process weaknesses
rootCauseAnalysis.retention: Permanent retention for quality improvement and lesson learned
rootCauseAnalysis.auditTrail: Root cause analysis tracked with investigation timeline and supporting evidence
rootCauseAnalysis.businessImpact: Drives corrective actions and prevents recurrence of similar issues
rootCauseAnalysis.complianceNotes: AS9100: Required for corrective action effectiveness. FDA: Critical for CAPA requirements
rootCauseAnalysis.businessPurpose: Identifies fundamental causes to prevent problem recurrence
rootCauseAnalysis.businessJustification: Enables systemic improvements rather than symptom treatment
rootCauseAnalysis.consequences: Superficial analysis allows recurring problems and ongoing quality risks
